title: Fuel hike rumours spark panic buying
content: The daily consumption of petrol and diesel has recently doubled as a result of rumours of a fuel price hike.There was panic buying by vehicle owners and some fuel distribution stations have been hiding fuel stocks due to the high demand.According to sources, the Sri Lanka Transport Board and the Sri Lanka Railways had purchased 9,000 metric tons of fuel last Friday.The daily demand for diesel was 5,000 metric tons and has now increased to 10,000 metric tons. It was also revealed by reliable sources that the fuel shipment from Singapore, which contains 37,500 metric tons of diesel was released after the Ministry of Energy made the necessary payments.Raids are also being conducted to determine whether petrol stations are concealing fuel stocks and not releasing it to consumers.President Gotabaya Rajapaksa on 22 February directed Finance Minister Basil Rajapaksa and Ministry officials to immediately release the necessary funds to clear fuel shipments.A special Cabinet meeting was called on 22 February evening to discuss the power and fuel crises that have been raging for months. The Central Bank Governor and Treasury officials were also present.At the meeting, the President did not agree to negotiations on increasing fuel prices.
